exceptions.exn: In environment H1 : choice Unable to unify "choice" with "collection".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
choice -> collection

Premises:
collection = forall P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop, (forall x x' y : Ens, EQ x x' -> P x y -> P x' y) -> (forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (P E)) -> forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (fun A : Ens => forall x : Ens, IN x E -> EXType Ens (fun y : Ens => IN y A /\ P x y)) : Prop
choice = forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop), (forall a : A, EXType B (fun b : B => P a b)) -> EXType (A -> B) (fun f : A -> B => forall a : A, P a (f a)) : Prop
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> R -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiNword : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> InitialRing.Nword -> R
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos : forall R : Type, R -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Field_theory.NPEpow : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
InitialRing.gen_phiN : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.N -> R
Field_theory.NPEmul : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.mkPX : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_theory.pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
Ring_polynom.r_list_pow : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
BinNatDef.N.iter : BinNums.N -> forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> A
ssrbool.and4_rec : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) (P : Set), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P) -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 -> P
ssrbool.and4_rect : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) (P : Type), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P) -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 -> P
PeanoNat.Nat.ls_ls' : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, n < z -> A (S n) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, n <= z -> (forall m : nat, m <= z -> S n <= m -> A m) -> A n
ssrbool.prop_on2 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, P x y) -> Prop
RingMicromega.Op1_rect : forall P : RingMicromega.Op1 -> Type, P RingMicromega.Equal -> P RingMicromega.NonEqual -> P RingMicromega.Strict -> P RingMicromega.NonStrict -> forall o : RingMicromega.Op1, P o
Ring_polynom.ropp_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp
Ring_theory.morph_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)
Ring_polynom.rmul_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul
Ring_polynom.radd_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd
Ring_theory.morph_opp : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x))
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos rI cI ceqb phi mkpow mkmult_pow c lm) (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm))
Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (rP : R) (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult rI radd rsub cI ceqb phi get_sign mkpow mkmult_pow rP c lm) (radd rP (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm)))
BinNat.N.induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n -> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
Ring_polynom.PX : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Decidable.dec_imp : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable B -> Decidable.decidable (A -> B)
Ring_theory.sign_spec : forall (C : Type) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (get_sign : C -> option C), Ring_theory.sign_theory copp ceqb get_sign -> forall c c' : C, get_sign c = Some c' -> ceqb c (copp c') = true
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
Inductive Mon : Set := mon0 : Ring_polynom.Mon | zmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon | vmon : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.zmon _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.vmon _%positive_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> EnvRing.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C | PX : EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C Arguments EnvRing.Pol _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pinj {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PX {C}%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Ring_theory.ARsub_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rsub x y) (radd x (ropp y))
Ring_theory.ARopp_mul_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (rmul x y)) (rmul (ropp x) y)
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEO : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEI : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEc : C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEX : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEadd : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEsub : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C ->...-> Ring_polynom.PExpr C Arguments Ring_polynom.PExpr _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEO {C}%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEI {C}%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEX _%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEadd [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEsub [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEmul [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEopp [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PEpow [C]%type_scope _ _%N_scope
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Pinj : forall C : Type, BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
